dao

Class CustomerDAOJDBC

  • java.lang.Object
    • dao.CustomerDAOJDBC
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CustomerDAO

    public class CustomerDAOJDBC
extends java.lang.Object
implements CustomerDAO
    This class represents a concrete JDBC implementation of the CustomerDAO interface.
    Author:
    Ahmed Gamal

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CustomerDAOJDBC(DAOFactory daoFactory)
      Construct an Customer DAO for the given DAOFactory.

      Returns the Cutomer from the database matching the given ID, otherwise null.

      Returns the Cutomer from the database matching the given email and password, otherwise null.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CustomerDAOJDBC

        public CustomerDAOJDBC(DAOFactory daoFactory)
        Construct an Customer DAO for the given DAOFactory. Package private so that it can be constructed inside the DAO package only.
        Parameters:
        daoFactory - The DAOFactory to construct this Customer DAO for.

      • list

        public java.util.List<Customer> list()
                              throws DAOException
        Description copied from interface: CustomerDAO
        Returns a list of all Cutomers from the database ordered by Cutomer ID. The list is never null and is empty when the database does not contain any Cutomer.
        Specified by:
        list in interface CustomerDAO
        Returns:
        A list of all Cutomers from the database ordered by Cutomer ID.
        Throws:
        DAOException - If something fails at database level.

      • create

        public void create(Customer Customer)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   DAOException
        Description copied from interface: CustomerDAO
        Create the given Cutomer in the database. The Cutomer ID must be null, otherwise it will throw IllegalArgumentException. After creating, the DAO will set the obtained ID in the given Cutomer.
        Specified by:
        create in interface CustomerDAO
        Parameters:
        Customer - The Cutomer to be created in the database.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the Cutomer ID is not null.
        DAOException - If something fails at database level.

      • update

        public void update(Customer Customer)
            throws DAOException
        Description copied from interface: CustomerDAO
        Update the given Cutomer in the database. The Cutomer ID must not be null, otherwise it will throw IllegalArgumentException. Note: the password will NOT be updated. Use changePassword() instead.
        Specified by:
        update in interface CustomerDAO
        Parameters:
        Customer - The Cutomer to be updated in the database.
        Throws:
        DAOException - If something fails at database level.

      • delete

        public void delete(Customer Customer)
            throws DAOException
        Description copied from interface: CustomerDAO
        Delete the given Cutomer from the database. After deleting, the DAO will set the ID of the given Cutomer to null.
        Specified by:
        delete in interface CustomerDAO
        Parameters:
        Customer - The Cutomer to be deleted from the database.
        Throws:
        DAOException - If something fails at database level.

      • existEmail

        public boolean existEmail(java.lang.String email)
                   throws DAOException
        Description copied from interface: CustomerDAO
        Returns true if the given email address exist in the database.
        Specified by:
        existEmail in interface CustomerDAO
        Parameters:
        email - The email address which is to be checked in the database.
        Returns:
        True if the given email address exist in the database.
        Throws:
        DAOException - If something fails at database level.
